strings.Value: "Jubilost? Are you alive? I saw Nyrissa trying to kill you."
"So you let yourself be tempted by Nyrissa..."
[Attack] "I have little patience with Nyrissa's servants."
{n}Jubilost is writing in his notebook, looking as focused as usual.{/n} "{name}! I didn't expect you to get here so soon. Just a moment, I'm almost finished!"
"It's amazing that you managed to get here, {name}. I kept hoping that this wasn't going to happen, and bloodshed could be avoided."

"But not every death is final. I understood completely how the primal gnomes felt, when I returned to life here, in the House at the Edge of Time. The Host {d|Jubilost Immortal}didn't lie{/d} — I'm connected to {g|First World}the First World{/g}. And this connection is something more than just a chance to die a little less fully than the denizens of the {g|Material Plane}Material Plane{/g}. The First World is now... inside me. It's an eternal, seething, ever-changing. And it protects me from the {g|Bleaching}Bleaching{/g} better than any magic."

"But guess who helped me? Xae, our insane ghost friend from the dungeons under the {g|Candlemere}Candlemere{/g}! Though she's not a ghost {d|Jubilost Xae}any more{/d}, and significantly less insane, but who knows... According to her, she never died in a dungeon, but safely opened a portal to {g|First World}the First World{/g} and even regained her immortality."

"But guess who helped me? The unforgettable {d|Jubilost Nyrd}Nyrd Zottenropple{/d}! She seems to be settling into {g|First World}the First World{/g} quite well, and she hopped here like a grasshopper using her teleportation. She dragged my breathless body from under Nyrissa's nose, revived me, and brought back here with a heap of wishes, half-mad stories, and a request that I bring her something she calls books, but which I call kindling."

"Far from trying! She did kill me! Not that I was unprepared for such an outcome, but it's still an unpleasant and rather painful business. I'm not sure yet if I'm even going to include it in my publications. A painful death is not the sort of experience you want to read about over and over on a rainy evening by the fire."
"Of course. I just can't wait to pay a visit to Lady Nyrissa. I should like to help her become history — both literally and figuratively!"

"{g|Shyka}Shyka{/g}, the {g|Eldest}Eldest{/g} of Time, informed her that for this she has to thank a {mf|king|queen} from {g|Golarion}Golarion{/g} and some young — young, just think of it! — gnome named Jubilost. Shyka told Xae that she'd be able to save us in the House at the Edge of Time many thousands of years later. And she did! — She waited, she came, and she saved!"

"Strictly speaking, it was threats and blackmail, not temptation. But yes, I gave in. Why not, in the end? If she helps me do what you couldn't — find a solution of gnomes' exodus from {g|First World}the First World{/g} — that would make up for everything else. I might not be comfortable with killing my former companions, but sometimes the ends justify the means!"
